content: 32 Also some of their Kohathite kinsmen had charge of the rows of bread, to prepare them for each sabbath.

content: 33 Now these are the singers, the chiefs of Levitical clans who remained in the chambers free of other service, for they were on duty day and night.

content: 34 These were chiefs of Levitical clans, according to their lines; these chiefs lived in Jerusalem.

content: 35 The father of Gibeon, Jeiel, lived in Gibeon, and the name of his wife was Maacah.

content: 39 Ner begot Kish, Kish begot Saul, Saul begot Jonathan, Malchi-shua, Abinadab, and Eshbaal;

content: 1 The Philistines attacked Israel, and the men of Israel fled before the Philistines and fell on Mount Gilboa.
content_old: 1 The Philistines attacked Israel, and the men of Israel fled before the Philistines and fell on Mount Gilboa.

content: 2 The Philistines pursued Saul and his sons, and the Philistines struck down Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchi-shua, sons of Saul.
content_old: 2 The Philistines pursued Saul and his sons, and the Philistines struck down Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchi-shua, sons of Saul.

content: 3 The battle raged around Saul, and the archers hit him, and he was wounded by the archers.
content_old: 3 The battle raged around Saul, and the archers hit him, and he was wounded by the archers.

content: 4 Saul said to his arms-bearer, “Draw your sword and run me through, so that these uncircumcised may not come and make sport of me.” But his arms-bearer, out of great awe, refused; whereupon Saul grasped the sword and fell upon it.
content_old: 4 Saul said to his arms-bearer, “Draw your sword and run me through, so that these uncircumcised may not come and make sport of me.” But his arms-bearer, out of great awe, refused; whereupon Saul grasped the sword and fell upon it.

content: 5 When the arms-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he too fell on his sword and died.
content_old: 5 When the arms-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he too fell on his sword and died.

content: 6 Thus Saul and his three sons and his entire house died together.
content_old: 6 Thus Saul and his three sons and his entire house died together.

content: 7 And when all the men of Israel who were in the valley saw that they had fled and that Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned their towns and fled; the Philistines then came and occupied them.
content_old: 7 And when all the men of Israel who were in the valley saw that they had fled and that Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned their towns and fled; the Philistines then came and occupied them.

content: 8 The next day the Philistines came to strip the slain, and they found Saul and his sons lying on Mount Gilboa.
content_old: 8 The next day the Philistines came to strip the slain, and they found Saul and his sons lying on Mount Gilboa.

content: 9 They stripped him, and carried off his head and his armor, and sent them throughout the land of the Philistines to spread the news to their idols and among the people.
content_old: 9 They stripped him, and carried off his head and his armor, and sent them throughout the land of the Philistines to spread the news to their idols and among the people.

content: 10 They placed his armor in the temple of their god, and they impaled his head in the temple of Dagan.
content_old: 10 They placed his armor in the temple of their god, and they impaled his head in the temple of Dagan.

content: 11 When all Jabesh-gilead heard everything that the Philistines had done to Saul,
content_old: 11 When all Jabesh-gilead heard everything that the Philistines had done to Saul,

content: 12 all their stalwart men set out, removed the bodies of Saul and his sons, and brought them to Jabesh. They buried the bones under the oak tree in Jabesh, and they fasted for seven days.
content_old: 12 all their stalwart men set out, removed the bodies of Saul and his sons, and brought them to Jabesh. They buried the bones under the oak tree in Jabesh, and they fasted for seven days.

content: 13 Saul died for the trespass that he had committed against the LORD in not having fulfilled the command of the LORD; moreover, he had consulted a ghost to seek advice,
content_old: 13 Saul died for the trespass that he had committed against the LORD in not having fulfilled the command of the LORD; moreover, he had consulted a ghost to seek advice,

content: 1 All Israel gathered to David at Hebron and said, “We are your own flesh and blood.
content_old: 1 All Israel gathered to David at Hebron and said, “We are your own flesh and blood.

content: 2 Long before now, even when Saul was king, you were the leader of Israel; and the LORD your God said to you: You shall shepherd My people Israel; you shall be ruler of My people Israel.”
content_old: 2 Long before now, even when Saul was king, you were the leader of Israel; and the LORD your God said to you: You shall shepherd My people Israel; you shall be ruler of My people Israel.”

content: 3 All the elders of Israel came to the king at Hebron, and David made a pact with them in Hebron before the LORD. And they anointed David king over Israel, according to the word of the LORD through Samuel.
content_old: 3 All the elders of Israel came to the king at Hebron, and David made a pact with them in Hebron before the LORD. And they anointed David king over Israel, according to the word of the LORD through Samuel.

content: 4 David and all Israel set out for Jerusalem, that is Jebus, where the Jebusite inhabitants of the land lived.
content_old: 4 David and all Israel set out for Jerusalem, that is Jebus, where the Jebusite inhabitants of the land lived.

content: 5 David was told by the inhabitants of Jebus, “You will never get in here!” But David captured the stronghold of Zion; it is now the City of David.
content_old: 5 David was told by the inhabitants of Jebus, “You will never get in here!” But David captured the stronghold of Zion; it is now the City of David.

content: 6 David said, “Whoever attacks the Jebusites first will be the chief officer”; Joab son of Zeruiah attacked first, and became the chief.
content_old: 6 David said, “Whoever attacks the Jebusites first will be the chief officer”; Joab son of Zeruiah attacked first, and became the chief.

content: 7 David occupied the stronghold; therefore it was renamed the City of David.
content_old: 7 David occupied the stronghold; therefore it was renamed the City of David.

content: 8 David also fortified the surrounding area, from the Millo roundabout, and Joab rebuilt the rest of the city.
content_old: 8 David also fortified the surrounding area, from the Millo roundabout, and Joab rebuilt the rest of the city.

content: 9 David kept growing stronger, for the LORD of Hosts was with him.
content_old: 9 David kept growing stronger, for the LORD of Hosts was with him.

content: 10 And these were David’s chief warriors who strongly supported him in his kingdom, together with all Israel, to make him king, according to the word of the LORD concerning Israel.
content_old: 10 And these were David’s chief warriors who strongly supported him in his kingdom, together with all Israel, to make him king, according to the word of the LORD concerning Israel.

content: 11 This is the list of David’s warriors: Jashobeam son of Hachmoni, the chief officer; he wielded his spear against three hundred and slew them all on one occasion.
content_old: 11 This is the list of David’s warriors: Jashobeam son of Hachmoni, the chief officer; he wielded his spear against three hundred and slew them all on one occasion.

content: 12 Next to him was Eleazar son of Dodo, the Ahohite; he was one of the three warriors.
content_old: 12 Next to him was Eleazar son of Dodo, the Ahohite; he was one of the three warriors.

content: 13 He was with David at Pas Dammim when the Philistines gathered there for battle. There was a plot of ground full of barley there; the troops had fled from the Philistines,
content_old: 13 He was with David at Pas Dammim when the Philistines gathered there for battle. There was a plot of ground full of barley there; the troops had fled from the Philistines,

content: 14 but they took their stand in the middle of the plot and defended it, and they routed the Philistines. Thus the LORD wrought a great victory.
content_old: 14 but they took their stand in the middle of the plot and defended it, and they routed the Philistines. Thus the LORD wrought a great victory.

content: 15 Three of the thirty chiefs went down to the rock to David, at the cave of Adullam, while a force of Philistines was encamped in the Valley of Rephaim.
content_old: 15 Three of the thirty chiefs went down to the rock to David, at the cave of Adullam, while a force of Philistines was encamped in the Valley of Rephaim.

content: 16 David was then in the stronghold, and a Philistine garrison was then at Bethlehem.
content_old: 16 David was then in the stronghold, and a Philistine garrison was then at Bethlehem.

content: 17 David felt a craving and said, “If only I could get a drink of water from the cistern which is by the gate of Bethlehem!”
content_old: 17 David felt a craving and said, “If only I could get a drink of water from the cistern which is by the gate of Bethlehem!”

content: 18 So the three got through the Philistine camp, and drew water from the cistern which is by the gate of Bethlehem, and they carried it back to David. But David would not drink it, and he poured it out as a libation to the LORD.
content_old: 18 So the three got through the Philistine camp, and drew water from the cistern which is by the gate of Bethlehem, and they carried it back to David. But David would not drink it, and he poured it out as a libation to the LORD.

content: 19 For he said, “God forbid that I should do this! Can I drink the blood of these men who risked their lives?”—for they had brought it at the risk of their lives, and he would not drink it. Such were the exploits of the three warriors.
content_old: 19 For he said, “God forbid that I should do this! Can I drink the blood of these men who risked their lives?”—for they had brought it at the risk of their lives, and he would not drink it. Such were the exploits of the three warriors.

content: 20 Abshai, the brother of Joab, was head of another three. He once wielded his spear against three hundred and slew them. He won a name among the three;
content_old: 20 Abshai, the brother of Joab, was head of another three. He once wielded his spear against three hundred and slew them. He won a name among the three;

content: 21 among the three he was more highly regarded than the other two, and so he became their commander. However, he did not attain to the other three.
content_old: 21 among the three he was more highly regarded than the other two, and so he became their commander. However, he did not attain to the other three.

content: 22 Benaiah son of Jehoiada from Kabzeel was a brave soldier who performed great deeds. He killed the two sons of Ariel of Moab. Once, on a snowy day, he went down into a pit and killed a lion.
content_old: 22 Benaiah son of Jehoiada from Kabzeel was a brave soldier who performed great deeds. He killed the two sons of Ariel of Moab. Once, on a snowy day, he went down into a pit and killed a lion.

content: 23 He also killed an Egyptian, a giant of a man five cubits tall. The Egyptian had a spear in his hand, like a weaver’s beam, yet Benaiah went down against him with a club, wrenched the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand, and killed him with his own spear.
content_old: 23 He also killed an Egyptian, a giant of a man five cubits tall. The Egyptian had a spear in his hand, like a weaver’s beam, yet Benaiah went down against him with a club, wrenched the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand, and killed him with his own spear.

content: 24 Such were the exploits of Benaiah son of Jehoiada; and he won a name among the three warriors.
content_old: 24 Such were the exploits of Benaiah son of Jehoiada; and he won a name among the three warriors.

content: 25 He was highly regarded among the thirty, but he did not attain to the three. David put him in charge of his bodyguard.

content: 17 Some of the Benjaminites and Judahites came to the stronghold to David,

content: 18 and David went out to meet them, saying to them, “If you come on a peaceful errand, to support me, then I will make common cause with you, but if to betray me to my foes, for no injustice on my part, then let the God of our fathers take notice and give judgment.”
content_old: 18 and David went out to meet them, saying to them, “If you come on a peaceful errand, to support me, then I will make common cause with you, but if to betray me to my foes, for no injustice on my part, then let the God of our fathers take notice and give judgment.”

content: 19 Then the spirit seized Amasai, chief of the captains: “We are yours, David, On your side, son of Jesse; At peace, at peace with you, And at peace with him who supports you, For your God supports you.” So David accepted them, and placed them at the head of his band.
content_old: 19 Then the spirit seized Amasai, chief of the captains: “We are yours, David, On your side, son of Jesse; At peace, at peace with you, And at peace with him who supports you, For your God supports you.” So David accepted them, and placed them at the head of his band.

content: 20 Some Manassites went over to David’s side when he came with the Philistines to make war against Saul, but they were of no help to them, because the lords of the Philistines in council dismissed him, saying, “He will go over to the side of his lord, Saul, and it will cost us our heads”;
content_old: 20 Some Manassites went over to David’s side when he came with the Philistines to make war against Saul, but they were of no help to them, because the lords of the Philistines in council dismissed him, saying, “He will go over to the side of his lord, Saul, and it will cost us our heads”;

content: 21 when he went to Ziklag, these Manassites went over to his side—Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, and Zillethai, chiefs of the clans of Manasseh.
content_old: 21 when he went to Ziklag, these Manassites went over to his side—Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, and Zillethai, chiefs of the clans of Manasseh.

content: 22 It was they who gave support to David against the band, for all were valiant men; and they were officers of the force.

content: 23 Day in day out, people came to David to give him support, until there was an army as vast as the army of God.

content: 2 David said to the entire assembly of Israel, “If you approve, and if the LORD our God concurs, let us send far and wide to our remaining kinsmen throughout the territories of Israel, including the priests and Levites in the towns where they have pasturelands, that they should gather together to us
content_old: 2 David said to the entire assembly of Israel, “If you approve, and if the LORD our God concurs, let us send far and wide to our remaining kinsmen throughout the territories of Israel, including the priests and Levites in the towns where they have pasturelands, that they should gather together to us

content: 5 David then assembled all Israel from Shihor of Egypt to Lebo-hamath, in order to bring the Ark of God from Kiriath-jearim.

content: 6 David and all Israel went up to Baalah, Kiriath-jearim of Judah, to bring up from there the Ark of God, the LORD, Enthroned on the Cherubim, to which the Name was attached.
content_old: 6 David and all Israel went up to Baalah, Kiriath-jearim of Judah, to bring up from there the Ark of God, the LORD, Enthroned on the Cherubim, to which the Name was attached.

content: 7 They transported the Ark of God on a new cart from the house of Abinadab; Uzza and Ahio guided the cart,
content_old: 7 They transported the Ark of God on a new cart from the house of Abinadab; Uzza and Ahio guided the cart,

content: 8 and David and all Israel danced before God with all their might—with songs, lyres, harps, timbrels, cymbals, and trumpets.
content_old: 8 and David and all Israel danced before God with all their might—with songs, lyres, harps, timbrels, cymbals, and trumpets.

content: 9 But when they came to the threshing floor of Chidon, Uzza put out his hand to hold the Ark of God because the oxen had stumbled.
content_old: 9 But when they came to the threshing floor of Chidon, Uzza put out his hand to hold the Ark of God because the oxen had stumbled.

content: 10 The LORD was incensed at Uzza, and struck him down, because he laid a hand on the Ark; and so he died there before God.
content_old: 10 The LORD was incensed at Uzza, and struck him down, because he laid a hand on the Ark; and so he died there before God.

content: 11 David was distressed because the LORD had burst out against Uzza; and that place was named Perez-uzzah, as it is still called.
content_old: 11 David was distressed because the LORD had burst out against Uzza; and that place was named Perez-uzzah, as it is still called.

content: 12 David was afraid of God that day; he said, “How can I bring the Ark of God here?”
content_old: 12 David was afraid of God that day; he said, “How can I bring the Ark of God here?”

content: 13 So David did not remove the Ark to his place in the City of David; instead, he diverted it to the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.
content_old: 13 So David did not remove the Ark to his place in the City of David; instead, he diverted it to the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.

content: 1 King Hiram of Tyre sent envoys to David with cedar logs, stonemasons, and carpenters to build a palace for him.
content_old: 1 King Hiram of Tyre sent envoys to David with cedar logs, stonemasons, and carpenters to build a palace for him.

content: 2 Thus David knew that the LORD had established him as king over Israel, and that his kingship was highly exalted for the sake of His people Israel.
content_old: 2 Thus David knew that the LORD had established him as king over Israel, and that his kingship was highly exalted for the sake of His people Israel.

content: 3 David took more wives in Jerusalem, and David begot more sons and daughters.
content_old: 3 David took more wives in Jerusalem, and David begot more sons and daughters.

content: 4 These are the names of the children born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon;
content_old: 4 These are the names of the children born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon;

content: 5 Ibhar, Elishua, and Elpelet;
content_old: 5 Ibhar, Elishua, and Elpelet;

content: 6 Nogah, Nepheg, and Japhia;
content_old: 6 Nogah, Nepheg, and Japhia;

content: 7 Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet.
content_old: 7 Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet.

content: 8 When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up in search of David; but David heard of it, and he went out to them.
content_old: 8 When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up in search of David; but David heard of it, and he went out to them.

content: 9 The Philistines came and raided the Valley of Rephaim.
content_old: 9 The Philistines came and raided the Valley of Rephaim.

content: 10 David inquired of God, “Shall I go up against the Philistines? Will You deliver them into my hands?” And the LORD answered him, “Go up, and I will deliver them into your hands.”
content_old: 10 David inquired of God, “Shall I go up against the Philistines? Will You deliver them into my hands?” And the LORD answered him, “Go up, and I will deliver them into your hands.”

content: 11 Thereupon David ascended Baal-perazim, and David defeated them there. David said, “God burst out against my enemies by my hands as waters burst out.” That is why that place was named Baal-perazim.
content_old: 11 Thereupon David ascended Baal-perazim, and David defeated them there. David said, “God burst out against my enemies by my hands as waters burst out.” That is why that place was named Baal-perazim.

content: 12 They abandoned their gods there, and David ordered these to be burned.
content_old: 12 They abandoned their gods there, and David ordered these to be burned.

content: 13 Once again the Philistines raided the valley.
content_old: 13 Once again the Philistines raided the valley.

content: 14 David inquired of God once more, and God answered, “Do not go up after them, but circle around them and confront them at the baca trees.
content_old: 14 David inquired of God once more, and God answered, “Do not go up after them, but circle around them and confront them at the baca trees.

content: 15 And when you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the baca trees, then go out to battle, for God will be going in front of you to attack the Philistine forces.”
content_old: 15 And when you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the baca trees, then go out to battle, for God will be going in front of you to attack the Philistine forces.”

content: 16 David did as God had commanded him; and they routed the Philistines from Gibeon all the way to Gezer.
content_old: 16 David did as God had commanded him; and they routed the Philistines from Gibeon all the way to Gezer.

content: 1 He had houses made for himself in the City of David, and he prepared a place for the Ark of God, and pitched a tent for it.
content_old: 1 He had houses made for himself in the City of David, and he prepared a place for the Ark of God, and pitched a tent for it.

content: 2 Then David gave orders that none but the Levites were to carry the Ark of God, for the LORD had chosen them to carry the Ark of the LORD and to minister to Him forever.
content_old: 2 Then David gave orders that none but the Levites were to carry the Ark of God, for the LORD had chosen them to carry the Ark of the LORD and to minister to Him forever.

content: 3 David assembled all Israel in Jerusalem to bring up the Ark of the LORD to its place, which he had prepared for it.
content_old: 3 David assembled all Israel in Jerusalem to bring up the Ark of the LORD to its place, which he had prepared for it.

content: 4 Then David gathered together the Aaronides and the Levites:
content_old: 4 Then David gathered together the Aaronides and the Levites:

content: 5 the sons of Kohath: Uriel the officer and his kinsmen—120;
content_old: 5 the sons of Kohath: Uriel the officer and his kinsmen—120;

content: 6 the sons of Merari: Asaiah the officer and his kinsmen—220;
content_old: 6 the sons of Merari: Asaiah the officer and his kinsmen—220;

content: 7 the sons of Gershom: Joel the officer and his kinsmen—130;
content_old: 7 the sons of Gershom: Joel the officer and his kinsmen—130;

content: 8 the sons of Elizaphan: Shemaiah the officer and his kinsmen—200;
content_old: 8 the sons of Elizaphan: Shemaiah the officer and his kinsmen—200;

content: 9 the sons of Hebron: Eliel the officer and his kinsmen—80;
content_old: 9 the sons of Hebron: Eliel the officer and his kinsmen—80;

content: 10 the sons of Uzziel: Amminadab the officer and his kinsmen—112.
content_old: 10 the sons of Uzziel: Amminadab the officer and his kinsmen—112.

content: 11 David sent for Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and for the Levites: Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab.
content_old: 11 David sent for Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and for the Levites: Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab.

content: 12 He said to them, “You are the heads of the clans of the Levites; sanctify yourselves, you and your kinsmen, and bring up the Ark of the LORD God of Israel to the place I have prepared for it.
content_old: 12 He said to them, “You are the heads of the clans of the Levites; sanctify yourselves, you and your kinsmen, and bring up the Ark of the LORD God of Israel to the place I have prepared for it.

content: 13 Because you were not there the first time, the LORD our God burst out against us, for we did not show due regard for Him.”
content_old: 13 Because you were not there the first time, the LORD our God burst out against us, for we did not show due regard for Him.”

content: 14 The priests and Levites sanctified themselves in order to bring up the Ark of the LORD God of Israel.
content_old: 14 The priests and Levites sanctified themselves in order to bring up the Ark of the LORD God of Israel.

content: 15 The Levites carried the Ark of God by means of poles on their shoulders, as Moses had commanded in accordance with the word of the LORD.
content_old: 15 The Levites carried the Ark of God by means of poles on their shoulders, as Moses had commanded in accordance with the word of the LORD.

content: 16 David ordered the officers of the Levites to install their kinsmen, the singers, with musical instruments, harps, lyres, and cymbals, joyfully making their voices heard.
content_old: 16 David ordered the officers of the Levites to install their kinsmen, the singers, with musical instruments, harps, lyres, and cymbals, joyfully making their voices heard.

content: 17 So the Levites installed Heman son of Joel and, of his kinsmen, Asaph son of Berechiah; and, of the sons of Merari their kinsmen, Ethan son of Kushaiah.
content_old: 17 So the Levites installed Heman son of Joel and, of his kinsmen, Asaph son of Berechiah; and, of the sons of Merari their kinsmen, Ethan son of Kushaiah.

content: 18 Together with them were their kinsmen of second rank, Zechariah, Ben, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphalehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom and Jeiel the gatekeepers.
content_old: 18 Together with them were their kinsmen of second rank, Zechariah, Ben, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphalehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom and Jeiel the gatekeepers.

content: 19 Also the singers Heman, Asaph, and Ethan to sound the bronze cymbals,
content_old: 19 Also the singers Heman, Asaph, and Ethan to sound the bronze cymbals,

content: 20 and Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah with harps on alamoth;
content_old: 20 and Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah with harps on alamoth;

content: 21 also Mattithiah, Eliphalehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah, with lyres to lead on the sheminith;
content_old: 21 also Mattithiah, Eliphalehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah, with lyres to lead on the sheminith;

content: 22 also Chenaniah, officer of the Levites in song; he was in charge of the song because he was a master.
content_old: 22 also Chenaniah, officer of the Levites in song; he was in charge of the song because he was a master.

content: 23 Berechiah and Elkanah were gatekeepers for the Ark.
content_old: 23 Berechiah and Elkanah were gatekeepers for the Ark.

content: 24 Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer the priests sounded the trumpets before the Ark of God, and Obed-edom and Jehiah were gatekeepers for the Ark.
content_old: 24 Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer the priests sounded the trumpets before the Ark of God, and Obed-edom and Jehiah were gatekeepers for the Ark.

content: 25 Then David and the elders of Israel and the officers of the thousands who were going to bring up the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD from the house of Obed-edom were joyful.
content_old: 25 Then David and the elders of Israel and the officers of the thousands who were going to bring up the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD from the house of Obed-edom were joyful.

content: 26 Since God helped the Levites who were carrying the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD, they sacrificed seven bulls and seven rams.
content_old: 26 Since God helped the Levites who were carrying the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD, they sacrificed seven bulls and seven rams.

content: 27 Now David and all the Levites who were carrying the Ark, and the singers and Chenaniah, officer of song of the singers, were wrapped in robes of fine linen, and David wore a linen ephod.
content_old: 27 Now David and all the Levites who were carrying the Ark, and the singers and Chenaniah, officer of song of the singers, were wrapped in robes of fine linen, and David wore a linen ephod.

content: 28 All Israel brought up the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD with shouts and with blasts of the horn, with trumpets and cymbals, playing on harps and lyres.
content_old: 28 All Israel brought up the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD with shouts and with blasts of the horn, with trumpets and cymbals, playing on harps and lyres.

content: 1 They brought in the Ark of God and set it up inside the tent that David had pitched for it, and they sacrificed burnt offerings and offerings of well-being before God.
content_old: 1 They brought in the Ark of God and set it up inside the tent that David had pitched for it, and they sacrificed burnt offerings and offerings of well-being before God.

content: 2 When David finished sacrificing the burnt offerings and the offerings of well-being, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD.
content_old: 2 When David finished sacrificing the burnt offerings and the offerings of well-being, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD.

content: 3 And he distributed to every person in Israel—man and woman alike—to each a loaf of bread, a cake made in a pan, and a raisin cake.
content_old: 3 And he distributed to every person in Israel—man and woman alike—to each a loaf of bread, a cake made in a pan, and a raisin cake.

content: 4 He appointed Levites to minister before the Ark of the LORD, to invoke, to praise, and to extol the LORD God of Israel:
content_old: 4 He appointed Levites to minister before the Ark of the LORD, to invoke, to praise, and to extol the LORD God of Israel:

content: 5 Asaph the chief, Zechariah second in rank, Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-edom, and Jeiel, with harps and lyres, and Asaph sounding the cymbals,
content_old: 5 Asaph the chief, Zechariah second in rank, Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-edom, and Jeiel, with harps and lyres, and Asaph sounding the cymbals,

content: 6 and Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests, with trumpets, regularly before the Ark of the Covenant of God.
content_old: 6 and Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests, with trumpets, regularly before the Ark of the Covenant of God.

content: 7 Then, on that day, David first commissioned Asaph and his kinsmen to give praise to the LORD:
content_old: 7 Then, on that day, David first commissioned Asaph and his kinsmen to give praise to the LORD:

content: 8 “Praise the LORD; call on His name; proclaim His deeds among the peoples.
content_old: 8 “Praise the LORD; call on His name; proclaim His deeds among the peoples.

content: 9 Sing praises unto Him; speak of all His wondrous acts.
content_old: 9 Sing praises unto Him; speak of all His wondrous acts.

content: 10 Exult in His holy name; let all who seek the LORD rejoice.
content_old: 10 Exult in His holy name; let all who seek the LORD rejoice.

content: 11 Turn to the LORD, to His might; seek His presence constantly.
content_old: 11 Turn to the LORD, to His might; seek His presence constantly.

content: 12 Remember the wonders He has done; His portents and the judgments He has pronounced,
content_old: 12 Remember the wonders He has done; His portents and the judgments He has pronounced,

content: 13 O offspring of Israel, His servant, O descendants of Jacob, His chosen ones.
content_old: 13 O offspring of Israel, His servant, O descendants of Jacob, His chosen ones.

content: 14 He is the LORD our God; His judgments are throughout the earth.
content_old: 14 He is the LORD our God; His judgments are throughout the earth.

content: 15 Be ever mindful of His covenant, the promise He gave for a thousand generations,
content_old: 15 Be ever mindful of His covenant, the promise He gave for a thousand generations,

content: 16 that He made with Abraham, swore to Isaac,
content_old: 16 that He made with Abraham, swore to Isaac,

content: 17 and confirmed in a decree for Jacob, for Israel, as an eternal covenant,
content_old: 17 and confirmed in a decree for Jacob, for Israel, as an eternal covenant,

content: 18 saying,‘To you I will give the land of Canaan as your allotted heritage.’
content_old: 18 saying,‘To you I will give the land of Canaan as your allotted heritage.’

content: 19 You were then few in number, a handful, merely sojourning there,
content_old: 19 You were then few in number, a handful, merely sojourning there,

content: 20 wandering from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another.
content_old: 20 wandering from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another.

content: 21 He allowed no one to oppress them; He reproved kings on their account,
content_old: 21 He allowed no one to oppress them; He reproved kings on their account,

content: 22 ‘Do not touch My anointed ones; do not harm My prophets.’
content_old: 22 ‘Do not touch My anointed ones; do not harm My prophets.’

content: 23 “Sing to the LORD, all the earth. proclaim His victory day after day.
content_old: 23 “Sing to the LORD, all the earth. proclaim His victory day after day.

content: 24 Tell of His glory among the nations, His wondrous deeds among all peoples.
content_old: 24 Tell of His glory among the nations, His wondrous deeds among all peoples.

content: 25 For the LORD is great and much acclaimed, He is held in awe by all divine beings.
content_old: 25 For the LORD is great and much acclaimed, He is held in awe by all divine beings.

content: 26 All the gods of the peoples are mere idols, but the LORD made the heavens.
content_old: 26 All the gods of the peoples are mere idols, but the LORD made the heavens.

content: 27 Glory and majesty are before Him; strength and joy are in His place.
content_old: 27 Glory and majesty are before Him; strength and joy are in His place.

content: 28 “Ascribe to the LORD, O families of the peoples, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.
content_old: 28 “Ascribe to the LORD, O families of the peoples, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.

content: 29 Ascribe to the LORD the glory of His name, bring tribute and enter before Him, bow down to the LORD majestic in holiness.
content_old: 29 Ascribe to the LORD the glory of His name, bring tribute and enter before Him, bow down to the LORD majestic in holiness.

content: 30 Tremble in His presence, all the earth! The world stands firm; it cannot be shaken.
content_old: 30 Tremble in His presence, all the earth! The world stands firm; it cannot be shaken.

content: 31 Let the heavens rejoice and the earth exult;
content_old: 31 Let the heavens rejoice and the earth exult;

content: 32 Let the sea and all within it thunder, the fields and everything in them exult;
content_old: 32 Let the sea and all within it thunder, the fields and everything in them exult;

content: 33 then shall all the trees of the forest shout for joy at the presence of the LORD, for He is coming to rule the earth.
content_old: 33 then shall all the trees of the forest shout for joy at the presence of the LORD, for He is coming to rule the earth.

content: 34 Praise the LORD for He is good; His steadfast love is eternal.
content_old: 34 Praise the LORD for He is good; His steadfast love is eternal.

content: 35 Declare: Deliver us, O God, our deliverer, and gather us and save us from the nations, to acclaim Your holy name, to glory in Your praise.
content_old: 35 Declare: Deliver us, O God, our deliverer, and gather us and save us from the nations, to acclaim Your holy name, to glory in Your praise.

content: 36 Blessed is the LORD, God of Israel, from eternity to eternity.” And all the people said, “Amen” and “Praise the LORD.”
content_old: 36 Blessed is the LORD, God of Israel, from eternity to eternity.” And all the people said, “Amen” and “Praise the LORD.”

content: 37 He left Asaph and his kinsmen there before the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD to minister before the Ark regularly as each day required,
content_old: 37 He left Asaph and his kinsmen there before the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD to minister before the Ark regularly as each day required,

content: 38 as well as Obed-edom with their kinsmen—68; also Obed-edom son of Jedithun and Hosah as gatekeepers;
content_old: 38 as well as Obed-edom with their kinsmen—68; also Obed-edom son of Jedithun and Hosah as gatekeepers;

content: 39 also Zadok the priest and his fellow priests before the Tabernacle of the LORD at the shrine which was in Gibeon;
content_old: 39 also Zadok the priest and his fellow priests before the Tabernacle of the LORD at the shrine which was in Gibeon;

content: 40 to sacrifice burnt offerings to the LORD on the altar of the burnt offering regularly, morning and evening, in accordance with what was prescribed in the Teaching of the LORD with which He charged Israel.
content_old: 40 to sacrifice burnt offerings to the LORD on the altar of the burnt offering regularly, morning and evening, in accordance with what was prescribed in the Teaching of the LORD with which He charged Israel.

content: 41 With them were Heman and Jeduthun and the other selected men designated by name to give praise to the LORD, “For His steadfast love is eternal.”
content_old: 41 With them were Heman and Jeduthun and the other selected men designated by name to give praise to the LORD, “For His steadfast love is eternal.”

content: 42 Heman and Jeduthun had with them trumpets and cymbals to sound, and instruments for the songs of God; and the sons of Jeduthun were to be at the gate.
content_old: 42 Heman and Jeduthun had with them trumpets and cymbals to sound, and instruments for the songs of God; and the sons of Jeduthun were to be at the gate.

content: 1 When David settled in his palace, David said to the prophet Nathan, “Here I am dwelling in a house of cedar, while the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD is under tent-cloths.”
content_old: 1 When David settled in his palace, David said to the prophet Nathan, “Here I am dwelling in a house of cedar, while the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD is under tent-cloths.”

content: 2 Nathan said to David, “Do whatever you have in mind, for God is with you.”
content_old: 2 Nathan said to David, “Do whatever you have in mind, for God is with you.”

content: 3 But that same night the word of God came to Nathan:
content_old: 3 But that same night the word of God came to Nathan:

content: 4 “Go and say to My servant David: Thus said the LORD: You are not the one to build a house for Me to dwell in.
content_old: 4 “Go and say to My servant David: Thus said the LORD: You are not the one to build a house for Me to dwell in.

content: 5 From the day that I brought out Israel to this day, I have not dwelt in a house, but have from tent to tent and from one Tabernacle.
content_old: 5 From the day that I brought out Israel to this day, I have not dwelt in a house, but have from tent to tent and from one Tabernacle.

content: 6 As I moved about wherever Israel went, did I ever reproach any of the judges of Israel whom I appointed to care for My people Israel: Why have you not built Me a house of cedar?
content_old: 6 As I moved about wherever Israel went, did I ever reproach any of the judges of Israel whom I appointed to care for My people Israel: Why have you not built Me a house of cedar?

content: 7 “Further, say thus to My servant David: Thus said the LORD of Hosts: I took you from the pasture, from following the flock, to be ruler of My people Israel,
content_old: 7 “Further, say thus to My servant David: Thus said the LORD of Hosts: I took you from the pasture, from following the flock, to be ruler of My people Israel,

content: 8 and I have been with you wherever you went, and have cut down all your enemies before you. Moreover, I will give you renown like that of the greatest men on earth.
content_old: 8 and I have been with you wherever you went, and have cut down all your enemies before you. Moreover, I will give you renown like that of the greatest men on earth.

content: 9 I will establish a home for My people Israel and will plant them firm, so that they shall dwell secure and shall tremble no more. Evil men shall not wear them down anymore as in the past,
content_old: 9 I will establish a home for My people Israel and will plant them firm, so that they shall dwell secure and shall tremble no more. Evil men shall not wear them down anymore as in the past,

content: 10 ever since I appointed judges over My people Israel. I will subdue all your enemies. And I declare to you: The LORD will build a house for you.
content_old: 10 ever since I appointed judges over My people Israel. I will subdue all your enemies. And I declare to you: The LORD will build a house for you.

content: 11 When your days are done and you follow your fathers, I will raise up your offspring after you, one of your own sons, and I will establish his kingship.
content_old: 11 When your days are done and you follow your fathers, I will raise up your offspring after you, one of your own sons, and I will establish his kingship.

content: 12 He shall build a house for Me, and I will establish his throne forever.
content_old: 12 He shall build a house for Me, and I will establish his throne forever.

content: 13 I will be a father to him, and he shall be a son to Me, but I will never withdraw My favor from him as I withdrew it from your predecessor.
content_old: 13 I will be a father to him, and he shall be a son to Me, but I will never withdraw My favor from him as I withdrew it from your predecessor.

content: 14 I will install him in My house and in My kingship forever, and his throne shall be established forever.”
content_old: 14 I will install him in My house and in My kingship forever, and his throne shall be established forever.”

content: 15 Nathan spoke to David in accordance with all these words and all this prophecy.
content_old: 15 Nathan spoke to David in accordance with all these words and all this prophecy.

content: 16 Then King David came and sat before the LORD, and he said, “What am I, O LORD God, and what is my family, that You have brought me thus far?
content_old: 16 Then King David came and sat before the LORD, and he said, “What am I, O LORD God, and what is my family, that You have brought me thus far?

content: 17 Yet even this, O God, has seemed too little to You; for You have spoken of Your servant’s house for the future. You regard me as a man of distinction, O LORD God.
content_old: 17 Yet even this, O God, has seemed too little to You; for You have spoken of Your servant’s house for the future. You regard me as a man of distinction, O LORD God.

content: 18 What more can David add regarding the honoring of Your servant? You know Your servant.
content_old: 18 What more can David add regarding the honoring of Your servant? You know Your servant.

content: 19 O LORD, for Your servant’s sake, and of Your own accord, You have wrought this great thing, and made known all these great things.
content_old: 19 O LORD, for Your servant’s sake, and of Your own accord, You have wrought this great thing, and made known all these great things.

content: 20 O LORD, there is none like You, and there is no other God but You, as we have always heard.
content_old: 20 O LORD, there is none like You, and there is no other God but You, as we have always heard.

content: 21 And who is like Your people Israel, a unique nation on earth, whom God went and redeemed as His people, winning renown for Yourself for great and marvelous deeds, driving out nations before Your people whom You redeemed from Egypt.
content_old: 21 And who is like Your people Israel, a unique nation on earth, whom God went and redeemed as His people, winning renown for Yourself for great and marvelous deeds, driving out nations before Your people whom You redeemed from Egypt.

content: 22 You have established Your people Israel as Your very own people forever; and You, O LORD, have become their God.
content_old: 22 You have established Your people Israel as Your very own people forever; and You, O LORD, have become their God.

content: 23 “And now, O LORD, let Your promise concerning Your servant and his house be fulfilled forever; and do as You have promised.
content_old: 23 “And now, O LORD, let Your promise concerning Your servant and his house be fulfilled forever; and do as You have promised.

content: 24 Let it be fulfilled that Your name be glorified forever, in that men will say,‘The LORD of Hosts, God of Israel, is Israel’s God’; and may the house of Your servant David be established before You.
content_old: 24 Let it be fulfilled that Your name be glorified forever, in that men will say,‘The LORD of Hosts, God of Israel, is Israel’s God’; and may the house of Your servant David be established before You.

content: 25 Because You, my God, have revealed to Your servant that You will build a house for him, Your servant has ventured to pray to You.
content_old: 25 Because You, my God, have revealed to Your servant that You will build a house for him, Your servant has ventured to pray to You.

content: 26 And now, O LORD, You are God and You have made this gracious promise to Your servant.
content_old: 26 And now, O LORD, You are God and You have made this gracious promise to Your servant.

content: 1 Sometime afterward, David attacked the Philistines and subdued them; and David took Gath and its dependencies from the Philistines.
content_old: 1 Sometime afterward, David attacked the Philistines and subdued them; and David took Gath and its dependencies from the Philistines.

content: 2 He also defeated the Moabites; the Moabites became tributary vassals of David.
content_old: 2 He also defeated the Moabites; the Moabites became tributary vassals of David.

content: 3 David defeated Hadadezer, king of Zobah-hamath, who was on his way to set up his monument at the Euphrates River.
content_old: 3 David defeated Hadadezer, king of Zobah-hamath, who was on his way to set up his monument at the Euphrates River.

content: 4 David captured 1,000 chariots and 7,000 horsemen and 20,000 foot soldiers of his force; and David hamstrung all the chariot horses except for 100, which he retained.
content_old: 4 David captured 1,000 chariots and 7,000 horsemen and 20,000 foot soldiers of his force; and David hamstrung all the chariot horses except for 100, which he retained.

content: 5 And when the Arameans of Damascus came to the aid of King Hadadezer of Zobah-hamath, David struck down 22,000 of the Arameans.
content_old: 5 And when the Arameans of Damascus came to the aid of King Hadadezer of Zobah-hamath, David struck down 22,000 of the Arameans.

content: 6 David stationed garrisons in Aram of Damascus, and the Arameans became tributary vassals of David. The LORD gave David victory wherever he went.
content_old: 6 David stationed garrisons in Aram of Damascus, and the Arameans became tributary vassals of David. The LORD gave David victory wherever he went.

content: 7 David took the gold shields carried by Hadadezer’s retinue and brought them to Jerusalem;
content_old: 7 David took the gold shields carried by Hadadezer’s retinue and brought them to Jerusalem;

content: 8 and from Tibbath and Cun, towns of Hadadezer, David took a vast amount of copper, from which Solomon made the bronze tank, the columns, and the bronze vessels.
content_old: 8 and from Tibbath and Cun, towns of Hadadezer, David took a vast amount of copper, from which Solomon made the bronze tank, the columns, and the bronze vessels.

content: 9 When King Tou of Hamath heard that David had defeated the entire army of King Hadadezer of Zobah,
content_old: 9 When King Tou of Hamath heard that David had defeated the entire army of King Hadadezer of Zobah,

content: 10 he sent his son Hadoram to King David to greet him and to congratulate him on his military victory over Hadadezer—for Hadadezer had been at war with Tou; all manner of gold, silver, and copper objects.
content_old: 10 he sent his son Hadoram to King David to greet him and to congratulate him on his military victory over Hadadezer—for Hadadezer had been at war with Tou; all manner of gold, silver, and copper objects.

content: 11 King David dedicated these to the LORD, along with the other silver and gold that he had taken from all the nations: from Edom, Moab, and Ammon; from the Philistines and the Amalekites.
content_old: 11 King David dedicated these to the LORD, along with the other silver and gold that he had taken from all the nations: from Edom, Moab, and Ammon; from the Philistines and the Amalekites.

content: 12 Abshai son of Zeruiah struck down Edom in the Valley of Salt, 18,000 in all.
content_old: 12 Abshai son of Zeruiah struck down Edom in the Valley of Salt, 18,000 in all.

content: 13 He stationed garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites became vassals of David. The LORD gave David victory wherever he went.
content_old: 13 He stationed garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites became vassals of David. The LORD gave David victory wherever he went.

content: 14 David reigned over all Israel, and David executed true justice among all his people.
content_old: 14 David reigned over all Israel, and David executed true justice among all his people.

content: 15 Joab son of Zeruiah was commander of the army; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was recorder;
content_old: 15 Joab son of Zeruiah was commander of the army; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was recorder;

content: 16 Zadok son of Ahitub and Abimelech son of Abiathar were priests; Shavsha was scribe;
content_old: 16 Zadok son of Ahitub and Abimelech son of Abiathar were priests; Shavsha was scribe;

content: 1 Sometime afterward, Nahash the king of the Ammonites died, and his son succeeded him as king.
content_old: 1 Sometime afterward, Nahash the king of the Ammonites died, and his son succeeded him as king.

content: 2 David said, “I will keep faith with Hanun son of Nahash, since his father kept faith with me.” David sent messengers with condolences to him over his father. But when David’s courtiers came to the land of Ammon to Hanun, with condolences,
content_old: 2 David said, “I will keep faith with Hanun son of Nahash, since his father kept faith with me.” David sent messengers with condolences to him over his father. But when David’s courtiers came to the land of Ammon to Hanun, with condolences,

content: 3 the Ammonite officials said to Hanun, “Do you think David is really honoring your father just because he sent you men with condolences? Why, it is to explore, to subvert, and to spy out the land that his courtiers have come to you.”
content_old: 3 the Ammonite officials said to Hanun, “Do you think David is really honoring your father just because he sent you men with condolences? Why, it is to explore, to subvert, and to spy out the land that his courtiers have come to you.”

content: 4 So Hanun seized David’s courtiers, shaved them, and cut away half of their garments up to the buttocks, and sent them off.
content_old: 4 So Hanun seized David’s courtiers, shaved them, and cut away half of their garments up to the buttocks, and sent them off.

content: 5 When David was told about the men, he dispatched others to meet them, for the men were greatly embarrassed. And the king gave orders, “Stay in Jericho until your beards grow back; then you can return.”
content_old: 5 When David was told about the men, he dispatched others to meet them, for the men were greatly embarrassed. And the king gave orders, “Stay in Jericho until your beards grow back; then you can return.”

content: 6 The Ammonites realized that they had incurred the wrath of David; so Hanun and the Ammonites sent 1,000 silver talents to hire chariots and horsemen from Aram-naharaim, Aram-maacah, and Zobah.
content_old: 6 The Ammonites realized that they had incurred the wrath of David; so Hanun and the Ammonites sent 1,000 silver talents to hire chariots and horsemen from Aram-naharaim, Aram-maacah, and Zobah.

content: 7 They hired 32,000 chariots, the king of Maacah, and his army, who came and encamped before Medeba. The Ammonites were mobilized from their cities and came to do battle.
content_old: 7 They hired 32,000 chariots, the king of Maacah, and his army, who came and encamped before Medeba. The Ammonites were mobilized from their cities and came to do battle.

content: 8 On learning this, David sent out Joab and the whole army, the professional fighters.
content_old: 8 On learning this, David sent out Joab and the whole army, the professional fighters.

content: 9 The Ammonites marched out and took up their battle position at the entrance of the city, while the kings who came separately in the open.
content_old: 9 The Ammonites marched out and took up their battle position at the entrance of the city, while the kings who came separately in the open.

content: 10 Joab saw that there was a battle line against him both front and rear. So he made a selection from all the picked men of Israel and arrayed them against the Arameans,
content_old: 10 Joab saw that there was a battle line against him both front and rear. So he made a selection from all the picked men of Israel and arrayed them against the Arameans,

content: 11 and the rest of the troops he put under the command of his brother Abishai and arrayed them against the Ammonites.
content_old: 11 and the rest of the troops he put under the command of his brother Abishai and arrayed them against the Ammonites.

content: 12 Joab said, “If the Arameans prove too strong for me, you come to my aid; and if the Ammonites prove too strong for you, I will come to your aid.
content_old: 12 Joab said, “If the Arameans prove too strong for me, you come to my aid; and if the Ammonites prove too strong for you, I will come to your aid.

content: 13 Let us be strong and resolute for the sake of our people and the towns of our God; and the LORD will do what He deems right.”
content_old: 13 Let us be strong and resolute for the sake of our people and the towns of our God; and the LORD will do what He deems right.”

content: 14 Joab and the troops with him marched into battle against the Arameans, who fled before him.
content_old: 14 Joab and the troops with him marched into battle against the Arameans, who fled before him.

content: 15 And when the Ammonites saw that the Arameans had fled, they too fled before his brother Abishai, and withdrew into the city. So Joab went to Jerusalem.
content_old: 15 And when the Ammonites saw that the Arameans had fled, they too fled before his brother Abishai, and withdrew into the city. So Joab went to Jerusalem.

content: 16 When the Arameans saw that they had been routed by Israel, they sent messengers to bring out the Arameans from across the Euphrates; Shophach, Hadadezer’s army commander, led them.
content_old: 16 When the Arameans saw that they had been routed by Israel, they sent messengers to bring out the Arameans from across the Euphrates; Shophach, Hadadezer’s army commander, led them.

content: 17 David was informed of it; he assembled all Israel, crossed the Jordan, and came and took up positions against them. David drew up his forces against Aram; and they fought with him.
content_old: 17 David was informed of it; he assembled all Israel, crossed the Jordan, and came and took up positions against them. David drew up his forces against Aram; and they fought with him.

content: 18 But the Arameans were put to flight by Israel. David killed 7,000 Aramean charioteers and 40,000 footmen; he also killed Shophach, the army commander.
content_old: 18 But the Arameans were put to flight by Israel. David killed 7,000 Aramean charioteers and 40,000 footmen; he also killed Shophach, the army commander.

content: 1 At the turn of the year, the season when kings go out to battle, Joab led out the army force and devastated the land of Ammon, and then besieged Rabbah, while David remained in Jerusalem; Joab reduced Rabbah and left it in ruins.
content_old: 1 At the turn of the year, the season when kings go out to battle, Joab led out the army force and devastated the land of Ammon, and then besieged Rabbah, while David remained in Jerusalem; Joab reduced Rabbah and left it in ruins.

content: 2 David took the crown from the head of their king; he found that it weighed a talent of gold, and in it were precious stones. It was placed on David’s head. He also carried off a vast amount of booty from the city.
content_old: 2 David took the crown from the head of their king; he found that it weighed a talent of gold, and in it were precious stones. It was placed on David’s head. He also carried off a vast amount of booty from the city.

content: 3 He led out the people who lived there and he hacked them with saws and iron threshing boards and axes; David did thus to all the towns of Ammon. Then David and all the troops returned to Jerusalem.
content_old: 3 He led out the people who lived there and he hacked them with saws and iron threshing boards and axes; David did thus to all the towns of Ammon. Then David and all the troops returned to Jerusalem.

content: 4 After this, fighting broke out with the Philistines at Gezer; that was when Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Sippai, a descendant of the Rephaim, and they were humbled.
content_old: 4 After this, fighting broke out with the Philistines at Gezer; that was when Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Sippai, a descendant of the Rephaim, and they were humbled.

content: 5 Again there was fighting with the Philistines, and Elhanan son of Jair killed Lahmi, the brother of Goliath the Gittite; his spear had a shaft like a weaver’s beam.
content_old: 5 Again there was fighting with the Philistines, and Elhanan son of Jair killed Lahmi, the brother of Goliath the Gittite; his spear had a shaft like a weaver’s beam.

content: 6 Once again there was fighting at Gath. There was a giant of a man who had twenty-four fingers and toes, six on each hand and six on each foot; he too was descended from the Raphah.
content_old: 6 Once again there was fighting at Gath. There was a giant of a man who had twenty-four fingers and toes, six on each hand and six on each foot; he too was descended from the Raphah.

content: 7 When he taunted Israel, Jonathan son of David’s brother Shimea killed him.
content_old: 7 When he taunted Israel, Jonathan son of David’s brother Shimea killed him.

content: 1 Satan arose against Israel and incited David to number Israel.
content_old: 1 Satan arose against Israel and incited David to number Israel.

content: 2 David said to Joab and to the commanders of the army, “Go and count Israel from Beer-sheba to Dan and bring me information as to their number.”
content_old: 2 David said to Joab and to the commanders of the army, “Go and count Israel from Beer-sheba to Dan and bring me information as to their number.”

content: 3 Joab answered, “May the LORD increase His people a hundredfold; my lord king, are they not all subjects of my lord? Why should my lord require this? Why should it be a cause of guilt for Israel?”
content_old: 3 Joab answered, “May the LORD increase His people a hundredfold; my lord king, are they not all subjects of my lord? Why should my lord require this? Why should it be a cause of guilt for Israel?”

content: 4 However, the king’s command to Joab remained firm, so Joab set out and traversed all Israel; he then came to Jerusalem.
content_old: 4 However, the king’s command to Joab remained firm, so Joab set out and traversed all Israel; he then came to Jerusalem.

content: 5 Joab reported to David the number of the people that had been recorded. All Israel comprised 1,100,000 ready to draw the sword, while in Judah there were 470,000 men ready to draw the sword.
content_old: 5 Joab reported to David the number of the people that had been recorded. All Israel comprised 1,100,000 ready to draw the sword, while in Judah there were 470,000 men ready to draw the sword.

content: 6 He did not record among them Levi and Benjamin, because the king’s command had become repugnant to Joab.
content_old: 6 He did not record among them Levi and Benjamin, because the king’s command had become repugnant to Joab.

content: 7 God was displeased about this matter and He struck Israel.
content_old: 7 God was displeased about this matter and He struck Israel.

content: 8 David said to God, “I have sinned grievously in having done this thing; please remit the guilt of Your servant, for I have acted foolishly.”
content_old: 8 David said to God, “I have sinned grievously in having done this thing; please remit the guilt of Your servant, for I have acted foolishly.”

content: 9 The LORD ordered Gad, David’s seer:
content_old: 9 The LORD ordered Gad, David’s seer:

content: 10 “Go and tell David: Thus said the LORD: I offer you three things; choose one of them and I will bring it upon you.”
content_old: 10 “Go and tell David: Thus said the LORD: I offer you three things; choose one of them and I will bring it upon you.”

content: 11 Gad came to David and told him, “Thus said the LORD: Select for yourself
content_old: 11 Gad came to David and told him, “Thus said the LORD: Select for yourself

content: 12 a three-year famine; or that you be swept away three months before your adversaries with the sword of your enemies overtaking you; or three days of the sword of the LORD, pestilence in the land, the angel of the LORD wreaking destruction throughout the territory of Israel. Now consider what reply I shall take back to Him who sent me.”
content_old: 12 a three-year famine; or that you be swept away three months before your adversaries with the sword of your enemies overtaking you; or three days of the sword of the LORD, pestilence in the land, the angel of the LORD wreaking destruction throughout the territory of Israel. Now consider what reply I shall take back to Him who sent me.”

content: 13 David said to Gad, “I am in great distress. Let me fall into the hands of the LORD, for His compassion is very great; and let me not fall into the hands of men.”
content_old: 13 David said to Gad, “I am in great distress. Let me fall into the hands of the LORD, for His compassion is very great; and let me not fall into the hands of men.”

content: 14 The LORD sent a pestilence upon Israel, and 70,000 men fell in Israel.
content_old: 14 The LORD sent a pestilence upon Israel, and 70,000 men fell in Israel.

content: 15 God sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it, but as he was about to wreak destruction, the LORD saw and renounced further punishment and said to the destroying angel, “Enough! Stay your hand!” The angel of the LORD was then standing by the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
content_old: 15 God sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it, but as he was about to wreak destruction, the LORD saw and renounced further punishment and said to the destroying angel, “Enough! Stay your hand!” The angel of the LORD was then standing by the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.

content: 16 David looked up and saw the angel of the LORD standing between heaven and earth, with a drawn sword in his hand directed against Jerusalem. David and the elders, covered in sackcloth, threw themselves on their faces.
content_old: 16 David looked up and saw the angel of the LORD standing between heaven and earth, with a drawn sword in his hand directed against Jerusalem. David and the elders, covered in sackcloth, threw themselves on their faces.

content: 17 David said to God, “Was it not I alone who ordered the numbering of the people? I alone am guilty, and have caused severe harm; but these sheep, what have they done? O LORD my God, let Your hand fall upon me and my father’s house, and let not Your people be plagued!”
content_old: 17 David said to God, “Was it not I alone who ordered the numbering of the people? I alone am guilty, and have caused severe harm; but these sheep, what have they done? O LORD my God, let Your hand fall upon me and my father’s house, and let not Your people be plagued!”

content: 18 The angel of the LORD told Gad to inform David that David should go and set up an altar to the LORD on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
content_old: 18 The angel of the LORD told Gad to inform David that David should go and set up an altar to the LORD on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.

content: 19 David went up, following Gad’s instructions, which he had delivered in the name of the LORD.
content_old: 19 David went up, following Gad’s instructions, which he had delivered in the name of the LORD.

content: 20 Ornan too saw the angel; his four sons who were with him hid themselves while Ornan kept on threshing wheat.
content_old: 20 Ornan too saw the angel; his four sons who were with him hid themselves while Ornan kept on threshing wheat.

content: 21 David came to Ornan; when Ornan looked up, he saw David and came off the threshing floor and bowed low to David, with his face to the ground.
content_old: 21 David came to Ornan; when Ornan looked up, he saw David and came off the threshing floor and bowed low to David, with his face to the ground.

content: 22 David said to Ornan, “Sell me the site of the threshing floor, that I may build on it an altar to the LORD. Sell it to me at the full price, that the plague against the people will be checked.”
content_old: 22 David said to Ornan, “Sell me the site of the threshing floor, that I may build on it an altar to the LORD. Sell it to me at the full price, that the plague against the people will be checked.”

content: 23 Ornan said to David, “Take it and let my lord the king do whatever he sees fit. See, I donate oxen for burnt offerings, and the threshing boards for wood, as well as wheat for a meal offering—I donate all of it.”
content_old: 23 Ornan said to David, “Take it and let my lord the king do whatever he sees fit. See, I donate oxen for burnt offerings, and the threshing boards for wood, as well as wheat for a meal offering—I donate all of it.”

content: 24 But King David replied to Ornan, “No, I will buy them at the full price. I cannot make a present to the LORD of what belongs to you, or sacrifice a burnt offering that has cost me nothing.”
content_old: 24 But King David replied to Ornan, “No, I will buy them at the full price. I cannot make a present to the LORD of what belongs to you, or sacrifice a burnt offering that has cost me nothing.”

content: 25 So David paid Ornan for the site 600 shekels’ worth of gold.
content_old: 25 So David paid Ornan for the site 600 shekels’ worth of gold.

content: 26 And David built there an altar to the LORD and sacrificed burnt offerings and offerings of well-being. He invoked the LORD, who answered him with fire from heaven on the altar of burnt offerings.
content_old: 26 And David built there an altar to the LORD and sacrificed burnt offerings and offerings of well-being. He invoked the LORD, who answered him with fire from heaven on the altar of burnt offerings.

content: 27 The LORD ordered the angel to return his sword to its sheath.
content_old: 27 The LORD ordered the angel to return his sword to its sheath.

content: 28 At that time, when David saw that the LORD answered him at the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, then he sacrificed there—
content_old: 28 At that time, when David saw that the LORD answered him at the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, then he sacrificed there—

content: 29 for the Tabernacle of the LORD, which Moses had made in the wilderness, and the altar of burnt offerings, were at that time in the shrine at Gibeon,
content_old: 29 for the Tabernacle of the LORD, which Moses had made in the wilderness, and the altar of burnt offerings, were at that time in the shrine at Gibeon,

content: 1 David said, “Here will be the House of the LORD and here the altar of burnt offerings for Israel.”
content_old: 1 David said, “Here will be the House of the LORD and here the altar of burnt offerings for Israel.”

content: 2 David gave orders to assemble the aliens living in the land of Israel, and assigned them to be hewers, to quarry and dress stones for building the House of God.
content_old: 2 David gave orders to assemble the aliens living in the land of Israel, and assigned them to be hewers, to quarry and dress stones for building the House of God.

content: 3 Much iron for nails for the doors of the gates and for clasps did David lay aside, and so much copper it could not be weighed,
content_old: 3 Much iron for nails for the doors of the gates and for clasps did David lay aside, and so much copper it could not be weighed,

content: 4 and cedar logs without number—for the Sidonians and the Tyrians brought many cedar logs to David.
content_old: 4 and cedar logs without number—for the Sidonians and the Tyrians brought many cedar logs to David.

content: 5 For David thought, “My son Solomon is an untried youth, and the House to be built for the LORD is to be made exceedingly great to win fame and glory throughout all the lands; let me then lay aside material for him.” So David laid aside much material before he died.
content_old: 5 For David thought, “My son Solomon is an untried youth, and the House to be built for the LORD is to be made exceedingly great to win fame and glory throughout all the lands; let me then lay aside material for him.” So David laid aside much material before he died.

content: 6 Then he summoned his son Solomon and charged him with building the House for the LORD God of Israel.
content_old: 6 Then he summoned his son Solomon and charged him with building the House for the LORD God of Israel.

content: 7 David said to Solomon, “My son, I wanted to build a House for the name of the LORD my God.
content_old: 7 David said to Solomon, “My son, I wanted to build a House for the name of the LORD my God.

content: 8 But the word of the LORD came to me, saying,‘You have shed much blood and fought great battles; you shall not build a House for My name for you have shed much blood on the earth in My sight.
content_old: 8 But the word of the LORD came to me, saying,‘You have shed much blood and fought great battles; you shall not build a House for My name for you have shed much blood on the earth in My sight.

content: 9 But you will have a son who will be a man at rest, for I will give him rest from all his enemies on all sides; Solomon will be his name and I shall confer peace and quiet on Israel in his time.
content_old: 9 But you will have a son who will be a man at rest, for I will give him rest from all his enemies on all sides; Solomon will be his name and I shall confer peace and quiet on Israel in his time.

content: 10 He will build a House for My name; he shall be a son to Me and I to him a father, and I will establish his throne of kingship over Israel forever.’
content_old: 10 He will build a House for My name; he shall be a son to Me and I to him a father, and I will establish his throne of kingship over Israel forever.’

content: 11 Now, my son, may the LORD be with you, and may you succeed in building the House of the LORD your God as He promised you would.
content_old: 11 Now, my son, may the LORD be with you, and may you succeed in building the House of the LORD your God as He promised you would.

content: 12 Only let God give you sense and understanding and put you in charge of Israel and the observance of the Teaching of the LORD your God.
content_old: 12 Only let God give you sense and understanding and put you in charge of Israel and the observance of the Teaching of the LORD your God.

content: 13 Then you shall succeed, if you observantly carry out the laws and the rules that the LORD charged Moses to lay upon Israel. Be strong and of good courage; do not be afraid or dismayed.
content_old: 13 Then you shall succeed, if you observantly carry out the laws and the rules that the LORD charged Moses to lay upon Israel. Be strong and of good courage; do not be afraid or dismayed.

content: 14 See, by denying myself, I have laid aside for the House of the LORD one hundred thousand talents of gold and one million talents of silver, and so much copper and iron it cannot be weighed; I have also laid aside wood and stone, and you shall add to them.
content_old: 14 See, by denying myself, I have laid aside for the House of the LORD one hundred thousand talents of gold and one million talents of silver, and so much copper and iron it cannot be weighed; I have also laid aside wood and stone, and you shall add to them.

content: 15 An abundance of workmen is at your disposal—hewers, workers in stone and wood, and every kind of craftsman in every kind of material—
content_old: 15 An abundance of workmen is at your disposal—hewers, workers in stone and wood, and every kind of craftsman in every kind of material—

content: 16 gold, silver, copper, and iron without limit. Go and do it, and may the LORD be with you.”
content_old: 16 gold, silver, copper, and iron without limit. Go and do it, and may the LORD be with you.”

content: 17 David charged all the officers of Israel to support his son Solomon,
content_old: 17 David charged all the officers of Israel to support his son Solomon,

content: 18 “See, the LORD your God is with you, and He will give you rest on every side, for He delivered the inhabitants of the land into my hand so that the land lies conquered before the LORD and before His people.
content_old: 18 “See, the LORD your God is with you, and He will give you rest on every side, for He delivered the inhabitants of the land into my hand so that the land lies conquered before the LORD and before His people.

content: 1 When David reached a ripe old age, he made his son Solomon king over Israel.
content_old: 1 When David reached a ripe old age, he made his son Solomon king over Israel.

content: 2 Then David assembled all the officers of Israel and the priests and the Levites.
content_old: 2 Then David assembled all the officers of Israel and the priests and the Levites.

content: 3 The Levites, from the age of thirty and upward, were counted; the head-count of their males was 38,000:
content_old: 3 The Levites, from the age of thirty and upward, were counted; the head-count of their males was 38,000:

content: 4 of these there were 24,000 in charge of the work of the House of the LORD, 6,000 officers and magistrates,
content_old: 4 of these there were 24,000 in charge of the work of the House of the LORD, 6,000 officers and magistrates,

content: 5 4,000 gatekeepers, and 4,000 for praising the LORD “with instruments I devised for singing praises.”
content_old: 5 4,000 gatekeepers, and 4,000 for praising the LORD “with instruments I devised for singing praises.”

content: 6 David formed them into divisions: The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
content_old: 6 David formed them into divisions: The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

content: 7 The Gershonites: Ladan and Shimei.
content_old: 7 The Gershonites: Ladan and Shimei.

content: 8 The sons of Ladan: Jehiel the chief, Zetham, and Joel—3.
content_old: 8 The sons of Ladan: Jehiel the chief, Zetham, and Joel—3.

content: 9 The sons of Shimei: Shelomith, Haziel, and Haran—3. These were the chiefs of the clans of the Ladanites.
content_old: 9 The sons of Shimei: Shelomith, Haziel, and Haran—3. These were the chiefs of the clans of the Ladanites.

content: 10 And the sons of Shimei: Jahath, Zina, Jeush, and Beriah; these were the sons of Shimei—4.
content_old: 10 And the sons of Shimei: Jahath, Zina, Jeush, and Beriah; these were the sons of Shimei—4.

content: 11 Jahath was the chief and Zizah the second, but Jeush and Beriah did not have many children, so they were enrolled together as a single clan.
content_old: 11 Jahath was the chief and Zizah the second, but Jeush and Beriah did not have many children, so they were enrolled together as a single clan.

content: 12 The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel—4.
content_old: 12 The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel—4.

content: 13 The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses. Aaron was set apart, he and his sons, forever, to be consecrated as most holy, to make burnt offerings to the LORD and serve Him and pronounce blessings in His name forever.
content_old: 13 The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses. Aaron was set apart, he and his sons, forever, to be consecrated as most holy, to make burnt offerings to the LORD and serve Him and pronounce blessings in His name forever.

content: 14 As for Moses, the man of God, his sons were named after the tribe of Levi.
content_old: 14 As for Moses, the man of God, his sons were named after the tribe of Levi.

content: 15 The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer.
content_old: 15 The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer.

content: 1 The divisions of the Aaronites were: The sons of Aaron: Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

content: 2 Nadab and Abihu died in the lifetime of their father, and they had no children, so Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests.
content_old: 2 Nadab and Abihu died in the lifetime of their father, and they had no children, so Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests.

content: 3 David, Zadok of the sons of Eleazar, and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar divided them into offices by their tasks.
content_old: 3 David, Zadok of the sons of Eleazar, and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar divided them into offices by their tasks.

content: 4 The sons of Eleazar turned out to be more numerous by male heads than the sons of Ithamar, so they divided the sons of Eleazar into sixteen chiefs of clans and the sons of Ithamar into eight clans.

content: 5 They divided them by lot, both on an equal footing, since they were all sanctuary officers and officers of God—the sons of Eleazar and the sons of Ithamar.

content: 1 David and the officers of the army set apart for service the sons of Asaph, of Heman, and of Jeduthun, who prophesied to the accompaniment of lyres, harps, and cymbals. The list of men who performed this work, according to their service, was:

content: 2 Sons of Asaph: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asarelah—sons of Asaph under the charge of Asaph, who prophesied by order of the king.
